intro: Guatteria chlorantha, commonly known as the green guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
